alert.note: Alert for Bristol (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 10:08AM EDT until August 18 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL BRISTOL, BRISTOL, NORTHEASTERN NEWPORT AND EAST CENTRAL PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 1008 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 inches in 30 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Providence, Fall River, Pawtucket, East Providence, Cumberland, Bristol, Attleboro, Central Falls, Somerset, Portsmouth, Barrington, Swansea, Tiverton, Seekonk, Rehoboth, Warren and Prudence Island. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
